abstract: The Public Theater's new production of "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," a one-man show that is sharply critical of Jobs and Apple at points, will undergo changes in the aftermath of his death.
snippet: The Public Theater's new production of "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," a one-man show that is sharply critical of Jobs and Apple at points, will undergo changes in the aftermath of his death.
lead_paragraph: The Public Theater's new production of "The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs," a one-man show that is sharply critical of Mr. Jobs and Apple at points, will undergo changes in the aftermath of Mr. Jobs's death on Wednesday but begin performances as scheduled on Tuesday, Oct. 11, according to its creator, Mike Daisey.

headline.main: Monologist Says Jobs's Death Will Lead to Changes, but Not Softening, in Show
